sentences.en: A certain amount of malice kept him in condition.
sentences.cn: 因而有时也就会闹出一些恶作剧来.

sentences.en: And our nature holds so much envy and malice.
sentences.cn: 同时,我们的本性又有那么多的忌妒和刻毒.

sentences.en: He did it of [ out of ; through ] malice.
sentences.cn: 他做此 事 是出于恶意.

sentences.en: He sent the letter out of malice .
sentences.cn: 他出于恶意寄出了这封信。

sentences.en: He was actuated entirely by malice.
His envy and malice knew no bounds.
sentences.cn: 他的嫉妒心和恶意更遏止不住了.

sentences.en: His expression changed from kindness to malice.
sentences.cn: 他的表情从和蔼可亲变成满腔怨恨.

sentences.en: I detected a suggestion of malice in his remarks.
sentences.cn: 我觉察出他说的话略带恶意.

sentences.en: James bore her no malice (= did not feel any malice towards her ) .
She did it out of malice.
sentences.cn: 她出于恶意做了这件事.

sentences.en: There was a strong current of malice in many of his portraits.
sentences.cn: 他的许多肖像画中都透着一股强烈的怨恨。

sentences.en: There was no malice on his part.
To bear malice is more like a Frenchman than an Englishman.
sentences.cn: 容忍恶意是法国人的派头,而不是英国人的.

sentences.en: We feel no malice toward these fumigators.
sentences.cn: 我们对那帮烟薰消毒专家倒没恶意.
